lines.text: For me, my family was like, uh, Dances With Jews. Oh sure, we had names for our relatives like they had in that movie.
Well, we had "Eats With His Hands," "Spits When He Talks," "Makes Noise When He Bends," "Sweats Like a Pig," "Whines In a Cab," "Never Buys Retail," "Shaves His Back."
Who do you have to screw to get a vodka?
Buddy, my whole life I listened to ya' bellyache about your luck. Well, you are where you are because of who you are.
I'll never forget what my Uncle Moe said about little girls. He said, "Officer, she said she was 18!"
I didn't take your life, Stan. I gave you one.
Yeah, but you coulda been nicer.
"And now, the star of our show, the kamikaze of comedy! Fasten your seat belts, put on your crash helmets; because here he comes... Mr. Saturday Night... Buddy Young, Junior!"

[to the audience he's performing to]
I know you're out there, I can hear you reloading!
I just dropped 2 crab cakes in my shorts and nobody knows.
